results.title: Poetry for an Englishman
results.brief_description: A young girl, living with her family in a lighthouse, is fascinated by her brother’s aloofness and observes his relationship with an English sailor from a distance. Based on a short story, “My brother writes poetry for an Englishman” by Marris Murray. Cast includes Georgina Bradley (Janie), Nathan Dutton (brother), Anna Volska (mother) and John Sheerin (father).

results.title: Point break [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Bigelow, Peter Abrams, Robert L Levy and Largo Entertainment
results.brief_description: Kathryn Bigelow’s (Strange Days, Blue Steel) fourth feature is a study of masculinity and surfer culture. Johnny Utah (Keanu Reeves) is a rookie FBI agent working undercover trying to crack an elite group of bank robbers who wear masks of ex-Presidents to hide their identities. As the criminals are thought to belong to an exclusive surfer cult, Utah learns to surf to infiltrate the group. Utah selects Tyler (Lori Petty), who is unaware of his true identity, to teach him the breaks that will make him a convincing surfer and keep his cover sound. Utah meets Bodhi (Patrick Swayze) a top surfer and adrenalin junkie, for whom surfing has a spiritual and mythical significance. “Point Break” is an action film that contains some impressive stunts including car chases, leaps from aeroplanes, exploding petrol stations and memorable scenes of breaking waves. Reeves is interestingly cast as the straight-laced policeman who has to learn the speech and mannerisms of a stoner dude. Filmed in Hawaii, California, Oregon and Bondi Beach, New South Wales.

results.title: Poen
results.creator_credit: Josef Reeve, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A prose poem read by Leonard Cohen from his novel “Beautiful Losers” to the accompaniment of diverse photographs and other illustrations, with the camera moving in and out of the pictures often with surrealistic effect. He reads four times and each time the effect is different because of his rendition or the accompanying visuals. (Awards: Bilbao, Oberhausen)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Josef Reeve, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Pocahontas (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Eric Goldberg, Mike Gabriel, James Pentecost and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: The legendary tale of the meeting of Pocahontas, American Indian Princess, and Captain John Smith is vividly recreated with the Disney recipe for success; two cheeky animal companions, the racoon Meeko and hummingbird Flit, vibrant colours and captivating music. A film for the family to enjoy as Pocahontas learns to listen to her heart. Features the Academy Award winning score of Alan Menken and Stephen Schwartz.

results.title: Planning for Sydney
results.creator_credit: Dinah Van Dugteren, Joan Masterman, Judy Menczel and New South Wales. Dept. of Environment and Planning
results.brief_description: Presents Sydney in the early 1980’s as a growing modern city. Presenting the older historic buildings and introducing the city’s new developments.

results.title: Pluto's Christmas tree
results.creator_credit: Jack Hannah and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: The second last entry in the theatrical Mickey Mouse series which officially began in 1928. As in many of his latter cartoons, Mickey is largely a background foil of others, in this case Pluto and Chip ‘n’ Dale. Animated by George Kreisl, Fred Moore, Bill Justice, Volus Jones. Music by Joseph S. Dubin.

results.title: Plugger
results.creator_credit: Australian Football Video, AFL and Broadcom Australia Ltd
results.brief_description: Tony Lockett’s debut in 1983 showed a young kid with potential, someone who would go on to stand alongside football greats such as Coventry, Pratt, Coleman and Hudson. The path to glory was a slow, tumultuous, and public affair. He sustained serious injuries and made numerous tribunal appearances, his every move followed in the tabloids. Now retired, Plugger has an impressive statistical history which includes: tying the 1987 Brownlow Medal with John Platten, 1987 Club Best and Fairest, winner of the John Coleman Medal in 1987 with 117 goals, leading his club’s goalkicking on six occasions - 1984, 1985, 1986, 1987, 1989 and 1990, representing Victoria three times, and passing Coventry’s record to be the leading goal kicker of all time.

results.title: Plain sailing
results.creator_credit: Martin Cohen, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Designed to assist the small businessman by emphasising the necessity of a thorough knowledge and planning before embarking on a business venture. Describes some of the do’s and don’ts that can make or break a business.
